name: Boone Hall Plantation Experience
summary: Step back in time with a visit to one of America’s oldest working plantations.
description: Explore the sweeping oak-lined avenue, historic antebellum house, and scenic gardens at Boone Hall. Learn about Charleston’s complex history, from agriculture to Gullah culture. This single-day experience offers guided tours, time for independent exploration, and optional wine tastings or picnics along the riverfront.

location.description: Boone Hall Plantation & Gardens, Mount Pleasant, SC
location.address: 1235 Long Point Rd, Mt Pleasant, SC 29464, USA

activities.name: Historic Home Tour
activities.description: A guided tour through the Boone Hall mansion and preserved rooms.

activities.name: Gullah Culture Presentation
activities.description: A moving live presentation of Gullah storytelling and traditions.

name: Folly Beach Getaway
summary: Sun, surf, and coastal vibes just 20 minutes from downtown Charleston.
description: Folly Beach offers six miles of wide sandy beaches, perfect for swimming, surfing, or simply relaxing with a drink in hand. Local restaurants and live music spots make this a favorite Lowcountry destination for both residents and travelers.

activities.name: Surfing Lessons
activities.description: Learn to surf with local instructors — all levels welcome.

activities.name: Pier Walk
activities.description: A scenic stroll along the iconic Folly Beach Pier.

name: Charleston Historic Walking Tour
summary: Explore the cobblestone streets, antebellum architecture, and rich history of downtown Charleston.
description: This guided walking tour takes you through some of Charleston’s most iconic landmarks — from Rainbow Row and the Battery to hidden alleyways filled with charm and stories. Ideal for first-time visitors or locals looking to rediscover their city.

location.address: 122 E Bay St, Charleston, SC 29401, USA

activities.name: Rainbow Row Stop
activities.description: Photo stop and history briefing at Charleston’s most colorful landmark.

activities.name: Waterfront Park
activities.description: Stroll along the iconic Pineapple Fountain and harbor views.
